00016 // INCLUDE FILES
00017 #include <eiktbar.h>
00018 #include <eikenv.h>
00019 #include <w32adll.h>
00020 #include <avkon.hrh>
00021 
00022 #include "animation.pan"
00023 #include "animationdocument.h"
00024 #include "AnimationAppUi.h"
00025 #include "AnimationAppView.h"
00026 #include "animation.hrh"
00027 #include "clientdll.h"
00028 #include "clientimagecommander.h"
00029 
00030 // ============================ MEMBER FUNCTIONS ===============================
00031 
00032 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00033 // CAnimationAppUi::CAnimationAppUi()
00034 // C++ default constructor can NOT contain any code, that might leave.
00035 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00036 //
00037 CAnimationAppUi::CAnimationAppUi( RWsSession& aSession )
00038     : CAknAppUi(),                                // Base class constructor
00039       iClientDll( aSession ),                     // Animation client dll
00040       iClientCommander( iClientDll )              // Animation client object
00041     {
00042     // No implementation required
00043     }
00044 
00045 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046 // CAnimationAppUi::ConstructL()
00047 // Symbian 2nd phase constructor can leave.
00048 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 //
00050 void CAnimationAppUi::ConstructL()
00051     {
00052     // Perform the base class construction
00053     BaseConstructL(EAknEnableSkin);
00054 
00055     // Create an application view
00056     iAppView = CAnimationAppView::NewL( ClientRect() );
00057 
00058     // Allow the appview to receive keyboard input
00059     AddToStackL( iAppView );
00060 
00061     // Initialise the RClientDll class
00062     SetupClientDllL();
00063 
00064     // Initialise the RImageCommander class
00065     SetupImageCommanderL();
00066     }
00067 
00068 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00069 // CAnimationAppUi::SetupClientDllL()
00070 // Setup the animation client Dll.
00071 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00072 //
00073 void CAnimationAppUi::SetupClientDllL()
00074     {
00075     // Create the server dll filename
00076     TFileName serverDllFilename( KServerDllFilename );
00077 
00078     // Load the animation server, if an error occurs then
00079     // let higher level handle the problem
00080     User::LeaveIfError( iClientDll.Load( serverDllFilename ) );
00081     }
00082 
00083 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 // CAnimationAppUi::SetupImageCommanderL()
00085 // Setup the animation image commander.
00086 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00087 //
00088 void CAnimationAppUi::SetupImageCommanderL()
00089     {
00090     // Tell client to construct a server side object
00091     TBuf8<1> params( TInt8( 0 ) );
00092     RWindowBase* windowBase = iAppView->DrawableWindow();
00093     iClientCommander.ImageConstruct( *windowBase, 
00094                                      RImageCommander::KAnimationSquare, 
00095                                      params );
00096     }
00097 
00098 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00099 // CAnimationAppUi::~CAnimationAppUi()
00100 // Destructor.
00101 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00102 //
00103 CAnimationAppUi::~CAnimationAppUi()
00104     {
00105     // remove the application view from the stack
00106     RemoveFromStack( iAppView );
00107 
00108     // Close the animation object
00109     iClientCommander.Close ();
00110 
00111     // Close the animation server
00112     iClientDll.Close();
00113 
00114     // Delete and NULL the application view
00115     delete iAppView;
00116     iAppView = NULL;
00117     }
00118 
00119 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00120 // CAnimationAppUi::HandleCommandL()
00121 // Takes care of key event handling.
00122 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00123 //
00124 void CAnimationAppUi::HandleCommandL( TInt aCommand )
00125     {
00126     switch( aCommand )
00127         {
00128     // Exit the application
00129     case EEikCmdExit:
00130     case EAknSoftkeyExit:
00131         Exit();
00132         break;
00133 
00134     // Ask the animation to do something, in this case, reset
00135     case EEikCmdReset:
00136         iClientCommander.ImageCommand( RImageCommander::KAnimationReset );
00137         break;
00138 
00139     default:
00140         break;
00141         }
00142     }
00143     
00144 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00145 // void CAnimationAppUi::HandleResourceChangeL()
00146 // Handles a resource change
00147 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00148 //
00149 
00150 void CAnimationAppUi::HandleResourceChangeL( TInt aType )
00151     {
00152     CAknAppUi::HandleResourceChangeL( aType );
00153     if  ( aType == KEikDynamicLayoutVariantSwitch )
00154         {
00155         iAppView->HandleResolutionChange( ClientRect() );
00156         iClientCommander.ImageCommand( RImageCommander::KResolutionChange );
00157         }
00158     }
00159
